17280  }
17281  // handle last interval:
17282  if (intervalDataCount >= 2) // last pixel had multiple data points,
17283  // consolidate them to a cluster
17284  {
17285  if (lastIntervalEndKey <
17286  currentIntervalStartKey - keyEpsilon) // last point wasn't a
17287  // cluster, so first point of
17288  // this cluster must be at a
17289  // real data point
17290  lineData->append(QCPData(currentIntervalStartKey + keyEpsilon * 0.2,
17291  currentIntervalFirstPoint.value().value));
17292  lineData->append(
17293  QCPData(currentIntervalStartKey + keyEpsilon * 0.25, minValue));
17294  lineData->append(
17295  QCPData(currentIntervalStartKey + keyEpsilon * 0.75, maxValue));
17296  } else
17297  lineData->append(QCPData(currentIntervalFirstPoint.key(),
17298  currentIntervalFirstPoint.value().value));
17299  }
17300 
17301  if (scatterData) {
17302  double valueMaxRange = valueAxis->range().upper;
17303  double valueMinRange = valueAxis->range().lower;
17304  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
17305  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper + 1;
17306  double minValue = it.value().value;
17307  double maxValue = it.value().value;
17308  QCPDataMap::const_iterator minValueIt = it;
17309  QCPDataMap::const_iterator maxValueIt = it;
17310  QCPDataMap::const_iterator currentIntervalStart = it;
17311  int reversedFactor =
17312  keyAxis->rangeReversed() ? -1 : 1; // is used to calculate keyEpsilon
17313  // pixel into the correct direction
17314  int reversedRound =
17315  keyAxis->rangeReversed() ? 1 : 0; // is used to switch between floor
17316  // (normal) and ceil (reversed)
17317  // rounding of
17318  // currentIntervalStartKey
17319  double currentIntervalStartKey = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(
17320  (int)(keyAxis->coordToPixel(lower.key()) + reversedRound));
17321  double keyEpsilon = qAbs(
17322  currentIntervalStartKey -
17323  keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(currentIntervalStartKey) +
17324  1.0 * reversedFactor)); // interval of one pixel
17325  // on screen when mapped
17326  // to plot key
17327  // coordinates
17328  bool keyEpsilonVariable =
17329  keyAxis->scaleType() ==
17330  QCPAxis::stLogarithmic; // indicates whether keyEpsilon needs to be
17331  // updated after every interval (for log axes)
17332  int intervalDataCount = 1;
17333  ++it; // advance iterator to second data point because adaptive sampling
17334  // works in 1 point retrospect
17335  while (it != upperEnd) {
17336  if (it.key() < currentIntervalStartKey +
17337  keyEpsilon) // data point is still within same pixel,
17338  // so skip it and expand value span of
17339  // this pixel if necessary
17340  {
17341  if (it.value().value < minValue && it.value().value > valueMinRange &&
17342  it.value().value < valueMaxRange) {
17343  minValue = it.value().value;
17344  minValueIt = it;
17345  } else if (it.value().value > maxValue &&
17346  it.value().value > valueMinRange &&
17347  it.value().value < valueMaxRange) {
17348  maxValue = it.value().value;
17349  maxValueIt = it;
17350  }
17351  ++intervalDataCount;
17352  } else // new pixel started
17353  {
17354  if (intervalDataCount >=
17355  2) // last pixel had multiple data points, consolidate them
17356  {
17357  // determine value pixel span and add as many points in interval to
17358  // maintain certain vertical data density (this is specific to
17359  // scatter plot):
17360  double valuePixelSpan = qAbs(valueAxis->coordToPixel(minValue) -
17361  valueAxis->coordToPixel(maxValue));
17362  int dataModulo =
17363  qMax(1, qRound(intervalDataCount /
17364  (valuePixelSpan / 4.0))); // approximately every
17365  // 4 value pixels one
17366  // data point on
17367  // average
17368  QCPDataMap::const_iterator intervalIt = currentIntervalStart;
17369  int c = 0;
17370  while (intervalIt != it) {
17371  if ((c % dataModulo == 0 || intervalIt == minValueIt ||
17372  intervalIt == maxValueIt) &&
17373  intervalIt.value().value > valueMinRange &&
17374  intervalIt.value().value < valueMaxRange)
17375  scatterData->append(intervalIt.value());
17376  ++c;
17377  ++intervalIt;
17378  }
17379  } else if (currentIntervalStart.value().value > valueMinRange &&
17380  currentIntervalStart.value().value < valueMaxRange)
17381  scatterData->append(currentIntervalStart.value());
17382  minValue = it.value().value;
17383  maxValue = it.value().value;
17384  currentIntervalStart = it;
17385  currentIntervalStartKey = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(
17386  (int)(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()) + reversedRound));
17387  if (keyEpsilonVariable)
17388  keyEpsilon =
17389  qAbs(currentIntervalStartKey -
17390  keyAxis->pixelToCoord(
17391  keyAxis->coordToPixel(currentIntervalStartKey) +
17392  1.0 * reversedFactor));
17393  intervalDataCount = 1;
17394  }
17395  ++it;
17396  }
17397  // handle last interval:
17398  if (intervalDataCount >=
17399  2) // last pixel had multiple data points, consolidate them
17400  {
17401  // determine value pixel span and add as many points in interval to
17402  // maintain certain vertical data density (this is specific to scatter
17403  // plot):
17404  double valuePixelSpan = qAbs(valueAxis->coordToPixel(minValue) -
17405  valueAxis->coordToPixel(maxValue));
17406  int dataModulo =
17407  qMax(1, qRound(intervalDataCount /
17408  (valuePixelSpan / 4.0))); // approximately every 4
17409  // value pixels one data
17410  // point on average
17411  QCPDataMap::const_iterator intervalIt = currentIntervalStart;
17412  int c = 0;
17413  while (intervalIt != it) {
17414  if ((c % dataModulo == 0 || intervalIt == minValueIt ||
17415  intervalIt == maxValueIt) &&
17416  intervalIt.value().value > valueMinRange &&
17417  intervalIt.value().value < valueMaxRange)
17418  scatterData->append(intervalIt.value());
17419  ++c;
17420  ++intervalIt;
17421  }
17422  } else if (currentIntervalStart.value().value > valueMinRange &&
17423  currentIntervalStart.value().value < valueMaxRange)
17424  scatterData->append(currentIntervalStart.value());
17425  }
17426  } else // don't use adaptive sampling algorithm, transfer points one-to-one
17427  // from the map into the output parameters
17428  {
17429  QVector<QCPData> *dataVector = 0;
17430  if (lineData)
17431  dataVector = lineData;
17432  else if (scatterData)
17433  dataVector = scatterData;
17434  if (dataVector) {
17435  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
17436  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper + 1;
17437  dataVector->reserve(dataCount + 2); // +2 for possible fill end points
17438  while (it != upperEnd) {
17439  dataVector->append(it.value());
17440  ++it;
17441  }
17442  }
17443  if (lineData && scatterData)
17444  *scatterData = *dataVector;
17445  }
17446 }
17447 
17458 void QCPGraph::drawError(QCPPainter *painter, double x, double y,
17459  const QCPData &data) const {
17460  if (qIsNaN(data.value))
17461  return;
17462  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17463  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17464  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) {
17465  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis";
17466  return;
17467  }
17468 
17469  double a, b; // positions of error bar bounds in pixels
17470  double barWidthHalf = mErrorBarSize * 0.5;
17471  double skipSymbolMargin = mScatterStyle.size(); // pixels left blank per side,
17472  // when mErrorBarSkipSymbol is
17473  // true
17474 
17475  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical) {
17476  // draw key error vertically and value error horizontally
17477  if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth) {
17478  a = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key - data.keyErrorMinus);
17479  b = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key + data.keyErrorPlus);
17480  if (keyAxis->rangeReversed())
17481  qSwap(a, b);
17482  // draw spine:
17483  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol) {
17484  if (a - y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small
17485  // it's within skipSymbolmargin
17486  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y + skipSymbolMargin));
17487  if (y - b > skipSymbolMargin)
17488  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y - skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
17489  } else
17490  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
17491  // draw handles:
17492  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x - barWidthHalf, a, x + barWidthHalf, a));
17493  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x - barWidthHalf, b, x + barWidthHalf, b));
17494  }
17495  if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth) {
17496  a = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value - data.valueErrorMinus);
17497  b = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value + data.valueErrorPlus);
17498  if (valueAxis->rangeReversed())
17499  qSwap(a, b);
17500  // draw spine:
17501  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol) {
17502  if (x - a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small
17503  // it's within skipSymbolmargin
17504  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x - skipSymbolMargin, y));
17505  if (b - x > skipSymbolMargin)
17506  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x + skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
17507  } else
17508  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
17509  // draw handles:
17510  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y - barWidthHalf, a, y + barWidthHalf));
17511  painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y - barWidthHalf, b, y + barWidthHalf));
17512  }
17513  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() is Qt::Horizontal
17514  {
17515  // draw value error vertically and key error horizontally
17516  if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth) {
17517  a = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key - data.keyErrorMinus);
17518  b = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key + data.keyErrorPlus);
17519  if (keyAxis->rangeReversed())
17520  qSwap(a, b);
17521  // draw spine:
17522  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol) {
17523  if (x - a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small
17524  // it's within skipSymbolmargin
17525  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x - skipSymbolMargin, y));
17526  if (b - x > skipSymbolMargin)
17527  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x + skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
17528  } else
17529  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
17530  // draw handles:
17531  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y - barWidthHalf, a, y + barWidthHalf));
17532  painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y - barWidthHalf, b, y + barWidthHalf));
17533  }
17534  if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth) {
17535  a = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value - data.valueErrorMinus);
17536  b = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value + data.valueErrorPlus);
17537  if (valueAxis->rangeReversed())
17538  qSwap(a, b);
17539  // draw spine:
17540  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol) {
17541  if (a - y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small
17542  // it's within skipSymbolmargin
17543  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y + skipSymbolMargin));
17544  if (y - b > skipSymbolMargin)
17545  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y - skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
17546  } else
17547  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
17548  // draw handles:
17549  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x - barWidthHalf, a, x + barWidthHalf, a));
17550  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x - barWidthHalf, b, x + barWidthHalf, b));
17551  }
17552  }
17553 }
17554 
17573 void QCPGraph::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPDataMap::const_iterator &lower,
17574  QCPDataMap::const_iterator &upper) const {
17575  if (!mKeyAxis) {
17576  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis";
17577  return;
17578  }
17579  if (mData->isEmpty()) {
17580  lower = mData->constEnd();
17581  upper = mData->constEnd();
17582  return;
17583  }
17584 
17585  // get visible data range as QMap iterators
17586  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lbound =
17587  mData->lowerBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
17588  QCPDataMap::const_iterator ubound =
17589  mData->upperBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
17590  bool lowoutlier = lbound != mData->constBegin(); // indicates whether there
17591  // exist points below axis
17592  // range
17593  bool highoutlier =
17594  ubound !=
17595  mData
17596  ->constEnd(); // indicates whether there exist points above axis range
17597 
17598  lower = (lowoutlier ? lbound - 1
17599  : lbound); // data point range that will be actually drawn
17600  upper = (highoutlier
17601  ? ubound
17602  : ubound - 1); // data point range that will be actually drawn
17603 }
17604 
17619 int QCPGraph::countDataInBounds(const QCPDataMap::const_iterator &lower,
17620  const QCPDataMap::const_iterator &upper,
17621  int maxCount) const {
17622  if (upper == mData->constEnd() && lower == mData->constEnd())
17623  return 0;
17624  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
17625  int count = 1;
17626  while (it != upper && count < maxCount) {
17627  ++it;
17628  ++count;
17629  }
17630  return count;
17631 }
17632 
17655 void QCPGraph::addFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const {
17656  if (!mKeyAxis) {
17657  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis";
17658  return;
17659  }
17660 
17661  // append points that close the polygon fill at the key axis:
17662  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical) {
17663  *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().y());
17664  *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().y());
17665  } else {
17666  *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().x());
17667  *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().x());
17668  }
17669 }
17670 
17678 void QCPGraph::removeFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const {
17679  lineData->remove(lineData->size() - 2, 2);
17680 }
17681 
17702 QPointF QCPGraph::lowerFillBasePoint(double lowerKey) const {
17703  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17704  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17705  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) {
17706  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis";
17707  return QPointF();
17708  }
17709 
17710  QPointF point;
17711  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear) {
17712  if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft) {
17713  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17714  point.setY(lowerKey);
17715  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight) {
17716  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17717  point.setY(lowerKey);
17718  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop) {
17719  point.setX(lowerKey);
17720  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17721  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom) {
17722  point.setX(lowerKey);
17723  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17724  }
17725  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
17726  {
17727  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value zero so we just fill
17728  // all the way
17729  // to the axis which is in the direction towards zero
17730  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical) {
17731  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
17732  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 &&
17733  valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on
17734  // opposite side of key axis
17735  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
17736  else
17737  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
17738  point.setY(lowerKey);
17739  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop ||
17740  keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom) {
17741  point.setX(lowerKey);
17742  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
17743  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 &&
17744  valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on
17745  // opposite side of key axis
17746  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
17747  else
17748  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
17749  }
17750  }
17751  return point;
17752 }
17753 
17774 QPointF QCPGraph::upperFillBasePoint(double upperKey) const {
17775  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17776  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17777  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) {
17778  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis";
17779  return QPointF();
17780  }
17781 
17782  QPointF point;
17783  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear) {
17784  if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft) {
17785  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17786  point.setY(upperKey);
17787  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight) {
17788  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17789  point.setY(upperKey);
17790  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop) {
17791  point.setX(upperKey);
17792  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17793  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom) {
17794  point.setX(upperKey);
17795  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
17796  }
17797  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
17798  {
17799  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value 0 so we just fill all
17800  // the way
17801  // to the axis which is in the direction towards 0
17802  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical) {
17803  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
17804  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 &&
17805  valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on
17806  // opposite side of key axis
17807  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
17808  else
17809  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
17810  point.setY(upperKey);
17811  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop ||
17812  keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom) {
17813  point.setX(upperKey);
17814  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
17815  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 &&
17816  valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on
17817  // opposite side of key axis
17818  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
17819  else
17820  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
17821  }
17822  }
17823  return point;
17824 }
17825 
17840 const QPolygonF
17841 QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const {
17842  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
17843  return QPolygonF();
17844 
17845  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17846  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17847  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) {
17848  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis";
17849  return QPolygonF();
17850  }
17851  if (!mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis) {
17852  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "channel fill target key axis invalid";
17853  return QPolygonF();
17854  }
17855 
17856  if (mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() !=
17857  keyAxis->orientation())
17858  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that
17859  // (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too,
17860  // because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
17861 
17862  if (lineData->isEmpty())
17863  return QPolygonF();
17864  QVector<QPointF> otherData;
17865  mChannelFillGraph.data()->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
17866  if (otherData.isEmpty())
17867  return QPolygonF();
17868  QVector<QPointF> thisData;
17869  thisData.reserve(lineData->size() + otherData.size()); // because we will join
17870  // both vectors at end
17871  // of this function
17872  for (int i = 0; i < lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector),
17873  // it squeezes internally, which
17874  // ruins the performance tuning
17875  // with reserve()
17876  thisData << lineData->at(i);
17877 
17878  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs
17879  // cropping:
17880  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
17881  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
17882 
17883  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key,
17884  // depends on axisType):
17885  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal) {
17886  // x is key
17887  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending.
17888  // Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
17889  if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x()) {
17890  int size = staticData->size();
17891  for (int i = 0; i < size / 2; ++i)
17892  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size - 1 - i]);
17893  }
17894  if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x()) {
17895  int size = croppedData->size();
17896  for (int i = 0; i < size / 2; ++i)
17897  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size - 1 - i]);
17898  }
17899  // crop lower bound:
17900  if (staticData->first().x() <
17901  croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
17902  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
17903  int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
17904  if (lowBound == -1)
17905  return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
17906  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
17907  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first
17908  // static data
17909  // point via linear interpolation:
17910  if (croppedData->size() < 2)
17911  return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
17912  double slope;
17913  if (croppedData->at(1).x() - croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
17914  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y() - croppedData->at(0).y()) /
17915  (croppedData->at(1).x() - croppedData->at(0).x());
17916  else
17917  slope = 0;
17918  (*croppedData)[0].setY(
17919  croppedData->at(0).y() +
17920  slope * (staticData->first().x() - croppedData->at(0).x()));
17921  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
17922 
17923  // crop upper bound:
17924  if (staticData->last().x() >
17925  croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
17926  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
17927  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
17928  if (highBound == -1)
17929  return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
17930  croppedData->remove(highBound + 1, croppedData->size() - (highBound + 1));
17931  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last
17932  // static data
17933  // point via linear interpolation:
17934  if (croppedData->size() < 2)
17935  return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
17936  int li = croppedData->size() - 1; // last index
17937  if (croppedData->at(li).x() - croppedData->at(li - 1).x() != 0)
17938  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y() - croppedData->at(li - 1).y()) /
17939  (croppedData->at(li).x() - croppedData->at(li - 1).x());
17940  else
17941  slope = 0;
17942  (*croppedData)[li].setY(
17943  croppedData->at(li - 1).y() +
17944  slope * (staticData->last().x() - croppedData->at(li - 1).x()));
17945  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
17946  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
17947  {
17948  // y is key
17949  // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is
17950  // inverted compared to x,
17951  // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom
17952  // to top like data coordinate.
17953  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending.
17954  // Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
17955  if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y()) {
17956  int size = staticData->size();
17957  for (int i = 0; i < size / 2; ++i)
17958  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size - 1 - i]);
17959  }
17960  if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y()) {
17961  int size = croppedData->size();
17962  for (int i = 0; i < size / 2; ++i)
17963  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size - 1 - i]);
17964  }
17965  // crop lower bound:
17966  if (staticData->first().y() >
17967  croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
17968  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
17969  int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
17970  if (lowBound == -1)
17971  return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
17972  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
17973  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first
17974  // static data
17975  // point via linear interpolation:
17976  if (croppedData->size() < 2)
17977  return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
17978  double slope;
17979  if (croppedData->at(1).y() - croppedData->at(0).y() !=
17980  0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
17981  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x() - croppedData->at(0).x()) /
17982  (croppedData->at(1).y() - croppedData->at(0).y());
17983  else
17984  slope = 0;
17985  (*croppedData)[0].setX(
17986  croppedData->at(0).x() +
17987  slope * (staticData->first().y() - croppedData->at(0).y()));
17988  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
17989 
17990  // crop upper bound:
17991  if (staticData->last().y() <
17992  croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
17993  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
17994  int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
17995  if (highBound == -1)
17996  return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
17997  croppedData->remove(highBound + 1, croppedData->size() - (highBound + 1));
17998  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last
17999  // static data
18000  // point via linear interpolation:
18001  if (croppedData->size() < 2)
18002  return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
18003  int li = croppedData->size() - 1; // last index
18004  if (croppedData->at(li).y() - croppedData->at(li - 1).y() !=
18005  0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
18006  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x() - croppedData->at(li - 1).x()) /
18007  (croppedData->at(li).y() - croppedData->at(li - 1).y());
18008  else
18009  slope = 0;
18010  (*croppedData)[li].setX(
18011  croppedData->at(li - 1).x() +
18012  slope * (staticData->last().y() - croppedData->at(li - 1).y()));
18013  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
18014  }
18015 
18016  // return joined:
18017  for (int i = otherData.size() - 1; i >= 0;
18018  --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
18019  thisData << otherData.at(i);
18020  return QPolygonF(thisData);
18021 }
18022 
18032 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const {
18033  for (int i = data->size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
18034  if (data->at(i).x() < x) {
18035  if (i < data->size() - 1)
18036  return i + 1;
18037  else
18038  return data->size() - 1;
18039  }
18040  }
18041  return -1;
18042 }
18043 
18053 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const {
18054  for (int i = 0; i < data->size(); ++i) {
18055  if (data->at(i).x() > x) {
18056  if (i > 0)
18057  return i - 1;
18058  else
18059  return 0;
18060  }
18061  }
18062  return -1;
18063 }
18064 
18074 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const {
18075  for (int i = 0; i < data->size(); ++i) {
18076  if (data->at(i).y() < y) {
18077  if (i > 0)
18078  return i - 1;
18079  else
18080  return 0;
18081  }
18082  }
18083  return -1;
18084 }
18085 
18099 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const {
18100  if (mData->isEmpty())
18101  return -1.0;
18102  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
18103  return -1.0;
18104 
18105  // calculate minimum distances to graph representation:
18106  if (mLineStyle == lsNone) {
18107  // no line displayed, only calculate distance to scatter points:
18108  QVector<QCPData> scatterData;
18109  getScatterPlotData(&scatterData);
18110  if (scatterData.size() > 0) {
18111  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
18112  for (int i = 0; i < scatterData.size(); ++i) {
18113  double currentDistSqr =
18114  QVector2D(
18115  coordsToPixels(scatterData.at(i).key, scatterData.at(i).value) -
18116  pixelPoint).lengthSquared();
18117  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
18118  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
18119  }
18120  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
18121  } else // no data available in view to calculate distance to
18122  return -1.0;
18123  } else {
18124  // line displayed, calculate distance to line segments:
18125  QVector<QPointF> lineData;
18126  getPlotData(
18127  &lineData,
18128  0); // unlike with getScatterPlotData we get pixel coordinates here
18129  if (lineData.size() >
18130  1) // at least one line segment, compare distance to line segments
18131  {
18132  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
18133  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse) {
18134  // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData
18135  // points are only pairwise connected:
18136  for (int i = 0; i < lineData.size() - 1; i += 2) // iterate pairs
18137  {
18138  double currentDistSqr =
18139  distSqrToLine(lineData.at(i), lineData.at(i + 1), pixelPoint);
18140  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
18141  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
18142  }
18143  } else {
18144  // all other line plots (line and step) connect points directly:
18145  for (int i = 0; i < lineData.size() - 1; ++i) {
18146  double currentDistSqr =
18147  distSqrToLine(lineData.at(i), lineData.at(i + 1), pixelPoint);
18148  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
18149  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
18150  }
18151  }
18152  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
18153  } else if (lineData.size() >
18154  0) // only single data point, calculate distance to that point
18155  {
18156  return QVector2D(lineData.at(0) - pixelPoint).length();
18157  } else // no data available in view to calculate distance to
18158  return -1.0;
18159  }
18160 }
18161 
18172 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const {
18173  for (int i = data->size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
18174  if (data->at(i).y() > y) {
18175  if (i < data->size() - 1)
18176  return i + 1;
18177  else
18178  return data->size() - 1;
18179  }
18180  }
18181  return -1;
18182 }
18183 
18184 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18185 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange,
18186  SignDomain inSignDomain) const {
18187  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument
18188  // whether error bars
18189  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this
18190  // to true here.
18191  return getKeyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
18192 }
18193 
18194 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18195 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange,
18196  SignDomain inSignDomain) const {
18197  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument
18198  // whether error bars
18199  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this
18200  // to true here.
18201  return getValueRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
18202 }
18203 
18211 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain,
18212  bool includeErrors) const {
18213  QCPRange range;
18214  bool haveLower = false;
18215  bool haveUpper = false;
18216 
18217  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
18218 
18219  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
18220  {
18221  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18222  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18223  if (!qIsNaN(it.value().value)) {
18224  current = it.value().key;
18225  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
18226  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
18227  if (current - currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) {
18228  range.lower = current - currentErrorMinus;
18229  haveLower = true;
18230  }
18231  if (current + currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) {
18232  range.upper = current + currentErrorPlus;
18233  haveUpper = true;
18234  }
18235  }
18236  ++it;
18237  }
18238  } else if (inSignDomain ==
18239  sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
18240  {
18241  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18242  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18243  if (!qIsNaN(it.value().value)) {
18244  current = it.value().key;
18245  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
18246  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
18247  if ((current - currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) &&
18248  current - currentErrorMinus < 0) {
18249  range.lower = current - currentErrorMinus;
18250  haveLower = true;
18251  }
18252  if ((current + currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) &&
18253  current + currentErrorPlus < 0) {
18254  range.upper = current + currentErrorPlus;
18255  haveUpper = true;
18256  }
18257  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars
18258  // stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that
18259  // point.
18260  {
18261  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0) {
18262  range.lower = current;
18263  haveLower = true;
18264  }
18265  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0) {
18266  range.upper = current;
18267  haveUpper = true;
18268  }
18269  }
18270  }
18271  ++it;
18272  }
18273  } else if (inSignDomain ==
18274  sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
18275  {
18276  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18277  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18278  if (!qIsNaN(it.value().value)) {
18279  current = it.value().key;
18280  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
18281  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
18282  if ((current - currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) &&
18283  current - currentErrorMinus > 0) {
18284  range.lower = current - currentErrorMinus;
18285  haveLower = true;
18286  }
18287  if ((current + currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) &&
18288  current + currentErrorPlus > 0) {
18289  range.upper = current + currentErrorPlus;
18290  haveUpper = true;
18291  }
18292  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars
18293  // stretch beyond it, we still want to get that
18294  // point.
18295  {
18296  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0) {
18297  range.lower = current;
18298  haveLower = true;
18299  }
18300  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0) {
18301  range.upper = current;
18302  haveUpper = true;
18303  }
18304  }
18305  }
18306  ++it;
18307  }
18308  }
18309 
18310  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
18311  return range;
18312 }
18313 
18321 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain,
18322  bool includeErrors) const {
18323  QCPRange range;
18324  bool haveLower = false;
18325  bool haveUpper = false;
18326 
18327  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
18328 
18329  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
18330  {
18331  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18332  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18333  current = it.value().value;
18334  if (!qIsNaN(current)) {
18335  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
18336  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
18337  if (current - currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) {
18338  range.lower = current - currentErrorMinus;
18339  haveLower = true;
18340  }
18341  if (current + currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) {
18342  range.upper = current + currentErrorPlus;
18343  haveUpper = true;
18344  }
18345  }
18346  ++it;
18347  }
18348  } else if (inSignDomain ==
18349  sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
18350  {
18351  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18352  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18353  current = it.value().value;
18354  if (!qIsNaN(current)) {
18355  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
18356  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
18357  if ((current - currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) &&
18358  current - currentErrorMinus < 0) {
18359  range.lower = current - currentErrorMinus;
18360  haveLower = true;
18361  }
18362  if ((current + currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) &&
18363  current + currentErrorPlus < 0) {
18364  range.upper = current + currentErrorPlus;
18365  haveUpper = true;
18366  }
18367  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars
18368  // stretch beyond it, we still want to get that
18369  // point.
18370  {
18371  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0) {
18372  range.lower = current;
18373  haveLower = true;
18374  }
18375  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0) {
18376  range.upper = current;
18377  haveUpper = true;
18378  }
18379  }
18380  }
18381  ++it;
18382  }
18383  } else if (inSignDomain ==
18384  sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
18385  {
18386  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18387  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18388  current = it.value().value;
18389  if (!qIsNaN(current)) {
18390  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
18391  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
18392  if ((current - currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) &&
18393  current - currentErrorMinus > 0) {
18394  range.lower = current - currentErrorMinus;
18395  haveLower = true;
18396  }
18397  if ((current + currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) &&
18398  current + currentErrorPlus > 0) {
18399  range.upper = current + currentErrorPlus;
18400  haveUpper = true;
18401  }
18402  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars
18403  // stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that
18404  // point.
18405  {
18406  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0) {
18407  range.lower = current;
18408  haveLower = true;
18409  }
18410  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0) {
18411  range.upper = current;
18412  haveUpper = true;
18413  }
18414  }
18415  }
18416  ++it;
18417  }
18418  }
18419 
18420  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
18421  return range;
18422 }
18423 
18427 
18445 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData() : t(0), key(0), value(0) {}
18446 
18450 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData(double t, double key, double value)
18451  : t(t), key(key), value(value) {}
18452 
18456 
18508 QCPCurve::QCPCurve(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis)
18509  : QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis) {
18510  mData = new QCPCurveDataMap;
18511  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
18512  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
18513  mBrush.setColor(Qt::blue);
18514  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::NoBrush);
18515  mSelectedPen = mPen;
18516  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
18517  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
18518  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
18519 
18520  setScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle());
18521  setLineStyle(lsLine);
18522 }
18523 
18524 QCPCurve::~QCPCurve() { delete mData; }
18525 
18535 void QCPCurve::setData(QCPCurveDataMap *data, bool copy) {
18536  if (mData == data) {
18537  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO
18538  << "The data pointer is already in (and owned by) this plottable"
18539  << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(data);
18540  return;
18541  }
18542  if (copy) {
18543  *mData = *data;
18544  } else {
18545  delete mData;
18546  mData = data;
18547  }
18548 }
18549 
18558 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &key,
18559  const QVector<double> &value) {
18560  mData->clear();
18561  int n = t.size();
18562  n = qMin(n, key.size());
18563  n = qMin(n, value.size());
18564  QCPCurveData newData;
18565  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
18566  newData.t = t[i];
18567  newData.key = key[i];
18568  newData.value = value[i];
18569  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
18570  }
18571 }
18572 
18580 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &key,
18581  const QVector<double> &value) {
18582  mData->clear();
18583  int n = key.size();
18584  n = qMin(n, value.size());
18585  QCPCurveData newData;
18586  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
18587  newData.t =
18588  i; // no t vector given, so we assign t the index of the key/value pair
18589  newData.key = key[i];
18590  newData.value = value[i];
18591  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
18592  }
18593 }
18594 
18603 void QCPCurve::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style) {
18604  mScatterStyle = style;
18605 }
18606 
18616 void QCPCurve::setLineStyle(QCPCurve::LineStyle style) { mLineStyle = style; }
18617 
18622 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveDataMap &dataMap) {
18623  mData->unite(dataMap);
18624 }
18625 
18630 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveData &data) {
18631  mData->insertMulti(data.t, data);
18632 }
18633 
18639 void QCPCurve::addData(double t, double key, double value) {
18640  QCPCurveData newData;
18641  newData.t = t;
18642  newData.key = key;
18643  newData.value = value;
18644  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
18645 }
18646 
18657 void QCPCurve::addData(double key, double value) {
18658  QCPCurveData newData;
18659  if (!mData->isEmpty())
18660  newData.t = (mData->constEnd() - 1).key() + 1;
18661  else
18662  newData.t = 0;
18663  newData.key = key;
18664  newData.value = value;
18665  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
18666 }
18667 
18673 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &ts, const QVector<double> &keys,
18674  const QVector<double> &values) {
18675  int n = ts.size();
18676  n = qMin(n, keys.size());
18677  n = qMin(n, values.size());
18678  QCPCurveData newData;
18679  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
18680  newData.t = ts[i];
18681  newData.key = keys[i];
18682  newData.value = values[i];
18683  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
18684  }
18685 }
18686 
18691 void QCPCurve::removeDataBefore(double t) {
18692  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
18693  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < t)
18694  it = mData->erase(it);
18695 }
18696 
18701 void QCPCurve::removeDataAfter(double t) {
18702  if (mData->isEmpty())
18703  return;
18704  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(t);
18705  while (it != mData->end())
18706  it = mData->erase(it);
18707 }
18708 
18718 void QCPCurve::removeData(double fromt, double tot) {
18719  if (fromt >= tot || mData->isEmpty())
18720  return;
18721  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromt);
18722  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(tot);
18723  while (it != itEnd)
18724  it = mData->erase(it);
18725 }
18726 
18739 void QCPCurve::removeData(double t) { mData->remove(t); }
18740 
18745 void QCPCurve::clearData() { mData->clear(); }
18746 
18747 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18748 double QCPCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable,
18749  QVariant *details) const {
18750  Q_UNUSED(details)
18751  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
18752  return -1;
18753  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) {
18754  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis";
18755  return -1;
18756  }
18757 
18758  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
18759  return pointDistance(pos);
18760  else
18761  return -1;
18762 }
18763 
18764 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18765 void QCPCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter) {
18766  if (mData->isEmpty())
18767  return;
18768 
18769  // allocate line vector:
18770  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
18771 
18772  // fill with curve data:
18773  getCurveData(lineData);
18774 
18775 // check data validity if flag set:
18776 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
18777  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
18778  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it) {
18779  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().t) ||
18780  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
18781  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid."
18782  << "Plottable name:" << name();
18783  }
18784 #endif
18785 
18786  // draw curve fill:
18787  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0) {
18788  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
18789  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
18790  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
18791  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
18792  }
18793 
18794  // draw curve line:
18795  if (mLineStyle != lsNone && mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen &&
18796  mainPen().color().alpha() != 0) {
18797  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
18798  painter->setPen(mainPen());
18799  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
18800  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing
18801  // instead of polyline:
18802  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
18803  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
18804  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized) &&
18805  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching)) {
18806  int i = 0;
18807  bool lastIsNan = false;
18808  const int lineDataSize = lineData->size();
18809  while (i < lineDataSize &&
18810  (qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) ||
18811  qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x()))) // make sure first point is not NaN
18812  ++i;
18813  ++i; // because drawing works in 1 point retrospect
18814  while (i < lineDataSize) {
18815  if (!qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) &&
18816  !qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // NaNs create a gap in the line
18817  {
18818  if (!lastIsNan)
18819  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i - 1), lineData->at(i));
18820  else
18821  lastIsNan = false;
18822  } else
18823  lastIsNan = true;
18824  ++i;
18825  }
18826  } else {
18827  int segmentStart = 0;
18828  int i = 0;
18829  const int lineDataSize = lineData->size();
18830  while (i < lineDataSize) {
18831  if (qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) ||
18832  qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // NaNs create a gap in the line
18833  {
18834  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData() + segmentStart,
18835  i - segmentStart); // i, because we don't want
18836  // to include the current NaN
18837  // point
18838  segmentStart = i + 1;
18839  }
18840  ++i;
18841  }
18842  // draw last segment:
18843  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData() + segmentStart,
18844  lineDataSize - segmentStart);
18845  }
18846  }
18847 
18848  // draw scatters:
18849  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
18850  drawScatterPlot(painter, lineData);
18851 
18852  // free allocated line data:
18853  delete lineData;
18854 }
18855 
18856 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18857 void QCPCurve::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const {
18858  // draw fill:
18859  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush) {
18860  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
18861  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top() + rect.height() / 2.0,
18862  rect.width(), rect.height() / 3.0),
18863  mBrush);
18864  }
18865  // draw line vertically centered:
18866  if (mLineStyle != lsNone) {
18867  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
18868  painter->setPen(mPen);
18869  painter->drawLine(
18870  QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top() + rect.height() / 2.0, rect.right() + 5,
18871  rect.top() + rect.height() / 2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment
18872  // is missing from
18873  // dashed/dotted pens
18874  }
18875  // draw scatter symbol:
18876  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone()) {
18877  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
18878  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
18879  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap &&
18880  (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() ||
18881  mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height())) {
18882  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
18883  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(
18884  rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
18885  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
18886  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
18887  } else {
18888  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
18889  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
18890  }
18891  }
18892 }
18893 
18901 void QCPCurve::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter,
18902  const QVector<QPointF> *pointData) const {
18903  // draw scatter point symbols:
18904  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
18905  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
18906  for (int i = 0; i < pointData->size(); ++i)
18907  if (!qIsNaN(pointData->at(i).x()) && !qIsNaN(pointData->at(i).y()))
18908  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, pointData->at(i));
18909 }
18910 
18931 void QCPCurve::getCurveData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const {
18932  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
18933  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
18934  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) {
18935  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis";
18936  return;
18937  }
18938 
18939  // add margins to rect to compensate for stroke width
18940  double strokeMargin =
18941  qMax(qreal(1.0),
18942  qreal(mainPen().widthF() * 0.75)); // stroke radius + 50% safety
18943  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
18944  strokeMargin = qMax(strokeMargin, mScatterStyle.size());
18945  double rectLeft = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(
18946  keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().lower) -
18947  strokeMargin *
18948  ((keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical) != keyAxis->rangeReversed()
18949  ? -1
18950  : 1));
18951  double rectRight = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(
18952  keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().upper) +
18953  strokeMargin *
18954  ((keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical) != keyAxis->rangeReversed()
18955  ? -1
18956  : 1));
18957  double rectBottom = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(
18958  valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().lower) +
18959  strokeMargin * ((valueAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal) !=
18960  valueAxis->rangeReversed()
18961  ? -1
18962  : 1));
18963  double rectTop = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(
18964  valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().upper) -
18965  strokeMargin * ((valueAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal) !=
18966  valueAxis->rangeReversed()
18967  ? -1
18968  : 1));
18969  int currentRegion;
18970  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18971  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator prevIt = mData->constEnd() - 1;
18972  int prevRegion = getRegion(prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, rectLeft,
18973  rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
18974  QVector<QPointF> trailingPoints; // points that must be applied after all
18975  // other points (are generated only when
18976  // handling first point to get virtual
18977  // segment between last and first point
18978  // right)
18979  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
18980  currentRegion = getRegion(it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft,
18981  rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
18982  if (currentRegion != prevRegion) // changed region, possibly need to add
18983  // some optimized edge points or original
18984  // points if entering R
18985  {
18986  if (currentRegion !=
18987  5) // segment doesn't end in R, so it's a candidate for removal
18988  {
18989  QPointF crossA, crossB;
18990  if (prevRegion == 5) // we're coming from R, so add this point optimized
18991  {
18992  lineData->append(
18993  getOptimizedPoint(currentRegion, it.value().key, it.value().value,
18994  prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value,
18995  rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom));
18996  // in the situations 5->1/7/9/3 the segment may leave R and directly
18997  // cross through two outer regions. In these cases we need to add an
18998  // additional corner point
18999  *lineData << getOptimizedCornerPoints(
19000  prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt.value().key,
19001  prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft,
19002  rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
19003  } else if (mayTraverse(prevRegion, currentRegion) &&
19004  getTraverse(prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value,
19005  it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft,
19006  rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom, crossA,
19007  crossB)) {
19008  // add the two cross points optimized if segment crosses R and if
19009  // segment isn't virtual zeroth segment between last and first curve
19010  // point:
19011  QVector<QPointF> beforeTraverseCornerPoints,
19012  afterTraverseCornerPoints;
19013  getTraverseCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, rectLeft, rectTop,
19014  rectRight, rectBottom,
19015  beforeTraverseCornerPoints,
19016  afterTraverseCornerPoints);
19017  if (it != mData->constBegin()) {
19018  *lineData << beforeTraverseCornerPoints;
19019  lineData->append(crossA);
19020  lineData->append(crossB);
19021  *lineData << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
19022  } else {
19023  lineData->append(crossB);
19024  *lineData << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
19025  trailingPoints << beforeTraverseCornerPoints << crossA;
19026  }
19027  } else // doesn't cross R, line is just moving around in outside
19028  // regions, so only need to add optimized point(s) at the
19029  // boundary corner(s)
19030  {
19031  *lineData << getOptimizedCornerPoints(
19032  prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt.value().key,
19033  prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft,
19034  rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
19035  }
19036  } else // segment does end in R, so we add previous point optimized and
19037  // this point at original position
19038  {
19039  if (it == mData->constBegin()) // it is first point in curve and prevIt
19040  // is last one. So save optimized point
19041  // for adding it to the lineData in the
19042  // end
19043  trailingPoints << getOptimizedPoint(
19044  prevRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value,
19045  it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight,
19046  rectBottom);
19047  else
19048  lineData->append(getOptimizedPoint(
19049  prevRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value,
19050  it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight,
19051  rectBottom));
19052  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
19053  }
19054  } else // region didn't change
19055  {
19056  if (currentRegion == 5) // still in R, keep adding original points
19057  {
19058  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
19059  } else // still outside R, no need to add anything
19060  {
19061  // see how this is not doing anything? That's the main optimization...
19062  }
19063  }
19064  prevIt = it;
19065  prevRegion = currentRegion;
19066  ++it;
19067  }
19068  *lineData << trailingPoints;
19069 }
19070 
19093 int QCPCurve::getRegion(double x, double y, double rectLeft, double rectTop,
19094  double rectRight, double rectBottom) const {
19095  if (x < rectLeft) // region 123
19096  {
19097  if (y > rectTop)
19098  return 1;
19099  else if (y < rectBottom)
19100  return 3;
19101  else
19102  return 2;
19103  } else if (x > rectRight) // region 789
19104  {
19105  if (y > rectTop)
19106  return 7;
19107  else if (y < rectBottom)
19108  return 9;
19109  else
19110  return 8;
19111  } else // region 456
19112  {
19113  if (y > rectTop)
19114  return 4;
19115  else if (y < rectBottom)
19116  return 6;
19117  else
19118  return 5;
19119  }
19120 }
19121 
19143 QPointF QCPCurve::getOptimizedPoint(int otherRegion, double otherKey,
19144  double otherValue, double key, double value,
19145  double rectLeft, double rectTop,
19146  double rectRight, double rectBottom) const {
19147  double intersectKey = rectLeft; // initial value is just fail-safe
19148  double intersectValue = rectTop; // initial value is just fail-safe
19149  switch (otherRegion) {
19150  case 1: // top and left edge
19151  {
19152  intersectValue = rectTop;
19153  intersectKey =
19154  otherKey +
19155  (key - otherKey) / (value - otherValue) * (intersectValue - otherValue);
19156  if (intersectKey < rectLeft ||
19157  intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
19158  {
19159  intersectKey = rectLeft;
19160  intersectValue =
19161  otherValue +
19162  (value - otherValue) / (key - otherKey) * (intersectKey - otherKey);
19163  }
19164  break;
19165  }
19166  case 2: // left edge
19167  {
19168  intersectKey = rectLeft;
19169  intersectValue =
19170  otherValue +
19171  (value - otherValue) / (key - otherKey) * (intersectKey - otherKey);
19172  break;
19173  }
19174  case 3: // bottom and left edge
19175  {
19176  intersectValue = rectBottom;
19177  intersectKey =
19178  otherKey +
19179  (key - otherKey) / (value - otherValue) * (intersectValue - otherValue);
19180  if (intersectKey < rectLeft ||
19181  intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
19182  {
19183  intersectKey = rectLeft;
19184  intersectValue =
19185  otherValue +
19186  (value - otherValue) / (key - otherKey) * (intersectKey - otherKey);
19187  }
19188  break;
19189  }
19190  case 4: // top edge
19191  {
19192  intersectValue = rectTop;
19193  intersectKey =
19194  otherKey +
19195  (key - otherKey) / (value - otherValue) * (intersectValue - otherValue);
19196  break;
19197  }
19198  case 5: {
19199  break; // case 5 shouldn't happen for this function but we add it anyway to
19200  // prevent potential discontinuity in branch table
19201  }
19202  case 6: // bottom edge
19203  {
19204  intersectValue = rectBottom;
19205  intersectKey =
19206  otherKey +
19207  (key - otherKey) / (value - otherValue) * (intersectValue - otherValue);
19208  break;
19209  }
19210  case 7: // top and right edge
19211  {
19212  intersectValue = rectTop;
19213  intersectKey =
19214  otherKey +
19215  (key - otherKey) / (value - otherValue) * (intersectValue - otherValue);
19216  if (intersectKey < rectLeft ||
19217  intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
19218  {
19219  intersectKey = rectRight;
19220  intersectValue =
19221  otherValue +
19222  (value - otherValue) / (key - otherKey) * (intersectKey - otherKey);
19223  }
19224  break;
19225  }
19226  case 8: // right edge
19227  {
19228  intersectKey = rectRight;
19229  intersectValue =
19230  otherValue +
19231  (value - otherValue) / (key - otherKey) * (intersectKey - otherKey);
19232  break;
19233  }
19234  case 9: // bottom and right edge
19235  {
19236  intersectValue = rectBottom;
19237  intersectKey =
19238  otherKey +
19239  (key - otherKey) / (value - otherValue) * (intersectValue - otherValue);
19240  if (intersectKey < rectLeft ||
19241  intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
19242  {
19243  intersectKey = rectRight;
19244  intersectValue =
19245  otherValue +
19246  (value - otherValue) / (key - otherKey) * (intersectKey - otherKey);
19247  }
19248  break;
19249  }
19250  }
19251  return coordsToPixels(intersectKey, intersectValue);
19252 }
19253 
19283 QVector<QPointF> QCPCurve::getOptimizedCornerPoints(
19284  int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double prevKey, double prevValue,
19285  double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight,
19286  double rectBottom) const {
19287  QVector<QPointF> result;
19288  switch (prevRegion) {
19289  case 1: {
19290  switch (currentRegion) {
19291  case 2: {
19292  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19293  break;
19294  }
19295  case 4: {
19296  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19297  break;
19298  }
19299  case 3: {
19300  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop)
19301  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19302  break;
19303  }
19304  case 7: {
19305  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop)
19306  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19307  break;
19308  }
19309  case 6: {
19310  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop)
19311  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19312  result.append(result.last());
19313  break;
19314  }
19315  case 8: {
19316  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop)
19317  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19318  result.append(result.last());
19319  break;
19320  }
19321  case 9: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may
19322  // pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top
19323  // left corner points
19324  if ((value - prevValue) / (key - prevKey) * (rectLeft - key) + value <
19325  rectBottom) // segment passes below R
19326  {
19327  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop)
19328  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19329  result.append(result.last());
19330  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19331  } else {
19332  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop)
19333  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19334  result.append(result.last());
19335  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19336  }
19337  break;
19338  }
19339  }
19340  break;
19341  }
19342  case 2: {
19343  switch (currentRegion) {
19344  case 1: {
19345  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19346  break;
19347  }
19348  case 3: {
19349  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19350  break;
19351  }
19352  case 4: {
19353  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19354  result.append(result.last());
19355  break;
19356  }
19357  case 6: {
19358  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19359  result.append(result.last());
19360  break;
19361  }
19362  case 7: {
19363  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19364  result.append(result.last());
19365  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19366  break;
19367  }
19368  case 9: {
19369  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19370  result.append(result.last());
19371  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19372  break;
19373  }
19374  }
19375  break;
19376  }
19377  case 3: {
19378  switch (currentRegion) {
19379  case 2: {
19380  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19381  break;
19382  }
19383  case 6: {
19384  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19385  break;
19386  }
19387  case 1: {
19388  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom)
19389  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19390  break;
19391  }
19392  case 9: {
19393  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom)
19394  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19395  break;
19396  }
19397  case 4: {
19398  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom)
19399  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19400  result.append(result.last());
19401  break;
19402  }
19403  case 8: {
19404  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom)
19405  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19406  result.append(result.last());
19407  break;
19408  }
19409  case 7: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may
19410  // pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top
19411  // left corner points
19412  if ((value - prevValue) / (key - prevKey) * (rectRight - key) + value <
19413  rectBottom) // segment passes below R
19414  {
19415  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom)
19416  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19417  result.append(result.last());
19418  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19419  } else {
19420  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom)
19421  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19422  result.append(result.last());
19423  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19424  }
19425  break;
19426  }
19427  }
19428  break;
19429  }
19430  case 4: {
19431  switch (currentRegion) {
19432  case 1: {
19433  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19434  break;
19435  }
19436  case 7: {
19437  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19438  break;
19439  }
19440  case 2: {
19441  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19442  result.append(result.last());
19443  break;
19444  }
19445  case 8: {
19446  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19447  result.append(result.last());
19448  break;
19449  }
19450  case 3: {
19451  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19452  result.append(result.last());
19453  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19454  break;
19455  }
19456  case 9: {
19457  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19458  result.append(result.last());
19459  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19460  break;
19461  }
19462  }
19463  break;
19464  }
19465  case 5: {
19466  switch (currentRegion) {
19467  case 1: {
19468  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19469  break;
19470  }
19471  case 7: {
19472  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19473  break;
19474  }
19475  case 9: {
19476  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19477  break;
19478  }
19479  case 3: {
19480  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19481  break;
19482  }
19483  }
19484  break;
19485  }
19486  case 6: {
19487  switch (currentRegion) {
19488  case 3: {
19489  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19490  break;
19491  }
19492  case 9: {
19493  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19494  break;
19495  }
19496  case 2: {
19497  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19498  result.append(result.last());
19499  break;
19500  }
19501  case 8: {
19502  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19503  result.append(result.last());
19504  break;
19505  }
19506  case 1: {
19507  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19508  result.append(result.last());
19509  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19510  break;
19511  }
19512  case 7: {
19513  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19514  result.append(result.last());
19515  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19516  break;
19517  }
19518  }
19519  break;
19520  }
19521  case 7: {
19522  switch (currentRegion) {
19523  case 4: {
19524  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19525  break;
19526  }
19527  case 8: {
19528  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19529  break;
19530  }
19531  case 1: {
19532  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop)
19533  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19534  break;
19535  }
19536  case 9: {
19537  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop)
19538  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19539  break;
19540  }
19541  case 2: {
19542  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop)
19543  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19544  result.append(result.last());
19545  break;
19546  }
19547  case 6: {
19548  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop)
19549  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19550  result.append(result.last());
19551  break;
19552  }
19553  case 3: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may
19554  // pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top
19555  // left corner points
19556  if ((value - prevValue) / (key - prevKey) * (rectRight - key) + value <
19557  rectBottom) // segment passes below R
19558  {
19559  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop)
19560  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19561  result.append(result.last());
19562  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19563  } else {
19564  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop)
19565  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19566  result.append(result.last());
19567  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19568  }
19569  break;
19570  }
19571  }
19572  break;
19573  }
19574  case 8: {
19575  switch (currentRegion) {
19576  case 7: {
19577  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19578  break;
19579  }
19580  case 9: {
19581  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19582  break;
19583  }
19584  case 4: {
19585  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19586  result.append(result.last());
19587  break;
19588  }
19589  case 6: {
19590  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19591  result.append(result.last());
19592  break;
19593  }
19594  case 1: {
19595  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19596  result.append(result.last());
19597  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19598  break;
19599  }
19600  case 3: {
19601  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19602  result.append(result.last());
19603  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19604  break;
19605  }
19606  }
19607  break;
19608  }
19609  case 9: {
19610  switch (currentRegion) {
19611  case 6: {
19612  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19613  break;
19614  }
19615  case 8: {
19616  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19617  break;
19618  }
19619  case 3: {
19620  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom)
19621  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19622  break;
19623  }
19624  case 7: {
19625  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom)
19626  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19627  break;
19628  }
19629  case 2: {
19630  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom)
19631  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19632  result.append(result.last());
19633  break;
19634  }
19635  case 4: {
19636  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom)
19637  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19638  result.append(result.last());
19639  break;
19640  }
19641  case 1: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may
19642  // pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top
19643  // left corner points
19644  if ((value - prevValue) / (key - prevKey) * (rectLeft - key) + value <
19645  rectBottom) // segment passes below R
19646  {
19647  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom)
19648  << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19649  result.append(result.last());
19650  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19651  } else {
19652  result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom)
19653  << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19654  result.append(result.last());
19655  result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19656  }
19657  break;
19658  }
19659  }
19660  break;
19661  }
19662  }
19663  return result;
19664 }
19665 
19683 bool QCPCurve::mayTraverse(int prevRegion, int currentRegion) const {
19684  switch (prevRegion) {
19685  case 1: {
19686  switch (currentRegion) {
19687  case 4:
19688  case 7:
19689  case 2:
19690  case 3:
19691  return false;
19692  default:
19693  return true;
19694  }
19695  }
19696  case 2: {
19697  switch (currentRegion) {
19698  case 1:
19699  case 3:
19700  return false;
19701  default:
19702  return true;
19703  }
19704  }
19705  case 3: {
19706  switch (currentRegion) {
19707  case 1:
19708  case 2:
19709  case 6:
19710  case 9:
19711  return false;
19712  default:
19713  return true;
19714  }
19715  }
19716  case 4: {
19717  switch (currentRegion) {
19718  case 1:
19719  case 7:
19720  return false;
19721  default:
19722  return true;
19723  }
19724  }
19725  case 5:
19726  return false; // should never occur
19727  case 6: {
19728  switch (currentRegion) {
19729  case 3:
19730  case 9:
19731  return false;
19732  default:
19733  return true;
19734  }
19735  }
19736  case 7: {
19737  switch (currentRegion) {
19738  case 1:
19739  case 4:
19740  case 8:
19741  case 9:
19742  return false;
19743  default:
19744  return true;
19745  }
19746  }
19747  case 8: {
19748  switch (currentRegion) {
19749  case 7:
19750  case 9:
19751  return false;
19752  default:
19753  return true;
19754  }
19755  }
19756  case 9: {
19757  switch (currentRegion) {
19758  case 3:
19759  case 6:
19760  case 8:
19761  case 7:
19762  return false;
19763  default:
19764  return true;
19765  }
19766  }
19767  default:
19768  return true;
19769  }
19770 }
19771 
19791 bool QCPCurve::getTraverse(double prevKey, double prevValue, double key,
19792  double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop,
19793  double rectRight, double rectBottom, QPointF &crossA,
19794  QPointF &crossB) const {
19795  QList<QPointF>
19796  intersections; // x of QPointF corresponds to key and y to value
19797  if (qFuzzyIsNull(key - prevKey)) // line is parallel to value axis
19798  {
19799  // due to region filter in mayTraverseR(), if line is parallel to value or
19800  // key axis, R is traversed here
19801  intersections.append(QPointF(
19802  key, rectBottom)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
19803  intersections.append(QPointF(key, rectTop));
19804  } else if (qFuzzyIsNull(value - prevValue)) // line is parallel to key axis
19805  {
19806  // due to region filter in mayTraverseR(), if line is parallel to value or
19807  // key axis, R is traversed here
19808  intersections.append(QPointF(
19809  rectLeft, value)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
19810  intersections.append(QPointF(rectRight, value));
19811  } else // line is skewed
19812  {
19813  double gamma;
19814  double keyPerValue = (key - prevKey) / (value - prevValue);
19815  // check top of rect:
19816  gamma = prevKey + (rectTop - prevValue) * keyPerValue;
19817  if (gamma >= rectLeft && gamma <= rectRight)
19818  intersections.append(QPointF(gamma, rectTop));
19819  // check bottom of rect:
19820  gamma = prevKey + (rectBottom - prevValue) * keyPerValue;
19821  if (gamma >= rectLeft && gamma <= rectRight)
19822  intersections.append(QPointF(gamma, rectBottom));
19823  double valuePerKey = 1.0 / keyPerValue;
19824  // check left of rect:
19825  gamma = prevValue + (rectLeft - prevKey) * valuePerKey;
19826  if (gamma >= rectBottom && gamma <= rectTop)
19827  intersections.append(QPointF(rectLeft, gamma));
19828  // check right of rect:
19829  gamma = prevValue + (rectRight - prevKey) * valuePerKey;
19830  if (gamma >= rectBottom && gamma <= rectTop)
19831  intersections.append(QPointF(rectRight, gamma));
19832  }
19833 
19834  // handle cases where found points isn't exactly 2:
19835  if (intersections.size() > 2) {
19836  // line probably goes through corner of rect, and we got duplicate points
19837  // there. single out the point pair with greatest distance in between:
19838  double distSqrMax = 0;
19839  QPointF pv1, pv2;
19840  for (int i = 0; i < intersections.size() - 1; ++i) {
19841  for (int k = i + 1; k < intersections.size(); ++k) {
19842  QPointF distPoint = intersections.at(i) - intersections.at(k);
19843  double distSqr =
19844  distPoint.x() * distPoint.x() + distPoint.y() + distPoint.y();
19845  if (distSqr > distSqrMax) {
19846  pv1 = intersections.at(i);
19847  pv2 = intersections.at(k);
19848  distSqrMax = distSqr;
19849  }
19850  }
19851  }
19852  intersections = QList<QPointF>() << pv1 << pv2;
19853  } else if (intersections.size() != 2) {
19854  // one or even zero points found (shouldn't happen unless line perfectly
19855  // tangent to corner), no need to draw segment
19856  return false;
19857  }
19858 
19859  // possibly re-sort points so optimized point segment has same direction as
19860  // original segment:
19861  if ((key - prevKey) * (intersections.at(1).x() - intersections.at(0).x()) +
19862  (value - prevValue) *
19863  (intersections.at(1).y() - intersections.at(0).y()) <
19864  0) // scalar product of both segments < 0 -> opposite direction
19865  intersections.move(0, 1);
19866  crossA = coordsToPixels(intersections.at(0).x(), intersections.at(0).y());
19867  crossB = coordsToPixels(intersections.at(1).x(), intersections.at(1).y());
19868  return true;
19869 }
19870 
19910 void QCPCurve::getTraverseCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion,
19911  double rectLeft, double rectTop,
19912  double rectRight, double rectBottom,
19913  QVector<QPointF> &beforeTraverse,
19914  QVector<QPointF> &afterTraverse) const {
19915  switch (prevRegion) {
19916  case 1: {
19917  switch (currentRegion) {
19918  case 6: {
19919  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19920  break;
19921  }
19922  case 9: {
19923  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19924  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19925  break;
19926  }
19927  case 8: {
19928  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19929  break;
19930  }
19931  }
19932  break;
19933  }
19934  case 2: {
19935  switch (currentRegion) {
19936  case 7: {
19937  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19938  break;
19939  }
19940  case 9: {
19941  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19942  break;
19943  }
19944  }
19945  break;
19946  }
19947  case 3: {
19948  switch (currentRegion) {
19949  case 4: {
19950  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19951  break;
19952  }
19953  case 7: {
19954  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19955  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19956  break;
19957  }
19958  case 8: {
19959  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19960  break;
19961  }
19962  }
19963  break;
19964  }
19965  case 4: {
19966  switch (currentRegion) {
19967  case 3: {
19968  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
19969  break;
19970  }
19971  case 9: {
19972  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
19973  break;
19974  }
19975  }
19976  break;
19977  }
19978  case 5: {
19979  break;
19980  } // shouldn't happen because this method only handles full traverses
19981  case 6: {
19982  switch (currentRegion) {
19983  case 1: {
19984  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
19985  break;
19986  }
19987  case 7: {
19988  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19989  break;
19990  }
19991  }
19992  break;
19993  }
19994  case 7: {
19995  switch (currentRegion) {
19996  case 2: {
19997  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
19998  break;
19999  }
20000  case 3: {
20001  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
20002  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
20003  break;
20004  }
20005  case 6: {
20006  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop);
20007  break;
20008  }
20009  }
20010  break;
20011  }
20012  case 8: {
20013  switch (currentRegion) {
20014  case 1: {
20015  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
20016  break;
20017  }
20018  case 3: {
20019  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom);
20020  break;
20021  }
20022  }
20023  break;
20024  }
20025  case 9: {
20026  switch (currentRegion) {
20027  case 2: {
20028  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
20029  break;
20030  }
20031  case 1: {
20032  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
20033  afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop);
20034  break;
20035  }
20036  case 4: {
20037  beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom);
20038  break;
20039  }
20040  }
20041  break;
20042  }
20043  }
20044 }
20045 
20054 double QCPCurve::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const {
20055  if (mData->isEmpty()) {
20056  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on curve" << mName
20057  << "without data";
20058  return 500;
20059  }
20060  if (mData->size() == 1) {
20061  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(),
20062  mData->constBegin().value().value);
20063  return QVector2D(dataPoint - pixelPoint).length();
20064  }
20065 
20066  // calculate minimum distance to line segments:
20067  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
20068  getCurveData(lineData);
20069  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
20070  for (int i = 0; i < lineData->size() - 1; ++i) {
20071  double currentDistSqr =
20072  distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i + 1), pixelPoint);
20073  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
20074  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
20075  }
20076  delete lineData;
20077  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
20078 }
20079 
20080 /* inherits documentation from base class */
20081 QCPRange QCPCurve::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange,
20082  SignDomain inSignDomain) const {
20083  QCPRange range;
20084  bool haveLower = false;
20085  bool haveUpper = false;
20086 
20087  double current;
20088 
20089  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
20090  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
20091  current = it.value().key;
20092  if (!qIsNaN(current) && !qIsNaN(it.value().value)) {
20093  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth ||
20094  (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) ||
20095  (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0)) {
20096  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower) {
20097  range.lower = current;
20098  haveLower = true;
20099  }
20100  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper) {
20101  range.upper = current;
20102  haveUpper = true;
20103  }
20104  }
20105  }
20106  ++it;
20107  }
20108 
20109  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
20110  return range;
20111 }
20112 
20113 /* inherits documentation from base class */
20114 QCPRange QCPCurve::getValueRange(bool &foundRange,
20115  SignDomain inSignDomain) const {
20116  QCPRange range;
20117  bool haveLower = false;
20118  bool haveUpper = false;
20119 
20120  double current;
20121 
20122  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
20123  while (it != mData->constEnd()) {
20124  current = it.value().value;
20125  if (!qIsNaN(current) && !qIsNaN(it.value().key)) {
20126  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth ||
